bash# Test the backend routes directly
curl -I "http://<redacted.ip>:40001/mem/search?limit=1&key=public-read-2025"
curl -I "http://<redacted.ip>:40001/mem/get?id=1369de11-d01f-4cb5-9b37-87d26ef0677b&key=public-read-2025"

If the backend tests show 404s, then the routes weren't properly added to the running instance. The memory_app.py might need to be restarted with the new routes.
Let's also check if the memory app is running the version with the new routes:
bash# Check if the new routes are actually loaded
tail -20 /media/mh/2TBU/memory_system/logs/app.log
If the backend routes are returning 404, we need to restart the memory_app service with the updated code:
bashcd /var/www/memory_system

# Stop the current process
pkill -f memory_app.py

# Start with the updated routes
source memory_venv/bin/activate
python memory_app.py
